title: Ann Griffiths Walk Route

images.title: John Firth / Ann Griffiths walk signs
images.caption: Ann Griffiths walk signs

images.title: Penny Mayes / Ann Griffiths Walk sign
images.caption: These book-on-a-lectern style signs are sited at picnic places along the walk. Lies in Llanfihangel-yng-Ngwynfa by the war memorial

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Ann Griffiths Walk near Dolanog
images.caption: Stile, marker and country view near Dolanog

images.title: Penny Mayes / Pont Llogel, Ann Griffiths Walk
images.caption: Pont Llogel, starting point for the walk. Ann Griffiths (1776-1805) was Wales' foremost female hymn writer, her hymns are sung in chapels throughout Wales to this day. The bronze lectern in the centre is a waymarker, erected to commemorate 200 years since her death. There are others along the path. The walk runs for 7 miles, from Pont Llogel, through Dolanog to Pont Robert.

images.title: John Firth / Ann Griffiths walk opposite Dolwar Fach entrance
images.caption: Opposite Dolwar Fach entrance

description: A lovely walk along the River Vyrnwy in Powys, with the Berwyn Mountains forming a splendid backdrop. The path runs for about 7 miles from Pont Lloge, Llwydiarth to Pontrobert with scenery including river valley and gorge, meadow, woodland and forest. The walk is named after the 18th Century hymn writer Ann Griffiths who lived in the area. You will pass locations associated with her life including her home at Dolwar Fach and her memorial chapel at Dolanog.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: At the western end of the route you'll find the expansive Dyfnant Forest where there's miles of good walking and cycling trails to try. To the north of Pont Llogel there's the beautiful Lake Vyrnwy and the Rhiwargor Waterfall to visit.

display_address: B4395, Pont Llogel, Llanfihangel, Powys, Cymru / Wales, SY21 0QQ, United Kingdom
